intro: Gongronema micradenia, commonly known as the small-leaf gongronema, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, round berries. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
